Kuda-Kuda.name: Kuda Tengah
Kuda-Kuda.desc: Basic Silat stance. Legs must be bent, back must be straight and arms in front above chest level. Hands/arms are away from the body and should not touch each other

Kuda-Kuda.name: Kuda Depan
Kuda-Kuda.desc: Front leg and back leg should be bent. Hands should be at neck level and away from your body. Both shoulders forward.

Kuda-Kuda.name: Kuda Samping
Kuda-Kuda.desc: Your body is completely to the side while facing your opponent.

Tangkisan.name: Tangkisan Luar
Tangkisan.desc: Both hands are open, but fingers are strong. Blocking hand is sightly angled. The other hand is at neck level (but not in front of your face)

Tangkisan.name: Tangkisan Dalam
Tangkisan.desc: Block comes from your ear and goes past your face. Your elbow should pass your belly button. Other hand can be at your hip or guarding your upper body

Tangkisan.name: Tangkisan Bawah
Tangkisan.desc: This block is to defend against a kick or low strike. Be sure your hand passes your body.

Tangkisan.name: Tangkisan Atas
Tangkisan.desc: Be sure to have your block go above your head with palm facing up. If you are blocking with your right hand, wrist should be right above your left eye.

Tangkisan.name: Tangkisan Kedalam
Tangkisan.desc: Your hand should be at belt level or below and away from your body.

Tangkisan.name: Guntingan Bawah
Tangkisan.desc: Blocking down with two hands crossed.

Tangkisan.name: Guntingan Atas
Tangkisan.desc: Blocking up with two hands crossed.

Pukulan.name: Pukulan Depan
Pukulan.desc: Punch comes from the waist. Fist must be tight and thumb always be on the outside.

Pukulan.name: Pukulan Satria
Pukulan.desc: Hand snaps outward and in. You hit with the back of the hand

Pukulan.name: Cengkeraman Gorila
Pukulan.desc: The strike is for the nose or other vital areas of the face. You can strike up, or strike downwards.

Pukulan.name: Pukul Silang
Pukulan.desc: Punching without stepping up - foot rises in the back

Pukulan.name: Pukulan Kuntul
Pukulan.desc: Striking with the middle knuckles (joint of middle phalanges)

Pukulan.name: Pukulan Sangkol
Pukulan.desc: Punch is directed to the chin or groin. Be sure to have your hand away from your body.

Langkah.name: Langkah Samping
Langkah.desc: Footwork to avoid an attack, but still be in kicking range. Body moves parallel.

Langkah.name: Langkah Serong
Langkah.desc: Footwork to avoid an attack, but still be in punching range. Body moves at a 45 degree angle.

Langkah.name: Langkah Silang Depan
Langkah.desc: Your moving foot crosses in FRONT of the other foot. You can move forwards or backwards as long as the foot that you move crosses IN FRONT of the other foot.

Langkah.name: Langkah Silang Belakang
Langkah.desc: Your moving foot crosses in BACK of the other foot. You can move forwards or backwards as long as the foot that you move crosses IN FRONT of the other foot.

Langkah.name: Langkah Lompat
Langkah.desc: This Lankgah is to avoid sweeps. The foot in front rises first, then you immediately switch stances.

Langkah.name: Langkah Lompat Mundur
Langkah.desc: This Lankgah is also avoid sweeps. The foot in front rises first, then you skip backwards

Langkah.name: Langkah Angkat Depan
Langkah.desc: Foot rises in front, body still facing forward

Langkah.name: Langkah Angkat Samping
Langkah.desc: Foot rises as body turns to the side.

Langkah.name: Langkah Lutut
Langkah.desc: Lower knee to the ground. Knee does not have to actually touch the ground

Tendangan.name: Tendangan Depan
Tendangan.desc: Get into proper stance, then lift the knee of your back leg up as high as you want to aim. Snap your leg out with your toes facing up. Hit with the BALL of your foot. Re-chamber your foot before putting it down.

Tendangan.name: Tendangan Sabit
Tendangan.desc: Lift the knee and let the foot follow. On your standing leg, twist on the ball of the foot, until the toes point away from one's opponent. Extend hip and hit opponent with straightened instep of foot. Pull the foot back in a straight line, so that your opponent can't grab your leg.

Tendangan.name: Tendangan Gejuk
Tendangan.desc: Low side-kick aiming towards the opponents knee.

Tendangan.name: Tendangan Te
Tendangan.desc: Literally the T-kick. Bring your leg up until your knee and foot is near your waist and butt is facing the attacker. This is called the CHAMBER (as you are bringing your leg into position in order to launch the side kick). Thrust your foot forward and strike your attacker with the sole of your foot or blade of your foot (outer edge of foot). Tip - Beginners can use a chair or rail in order to maintain their balance while practicing the fundamentals of a side kick.

Tendangan.name: Tendangan Te Belakang
Tendangan.desc: Begin in Kuda depan with your kicking leg back. Turn your body until you are facing directly away from your target. Look over your shoulder as you lift your knee to your chest. With your ankle bent, drive your right heel straight toward your target using your body weight to add power to your attack. Your foot should be angled downward.

Tendangan.name: Jontrot
Tendangan.desc: Place both hands on the ground. Bring your back leg down and land on your thigh. Kick from a low position to knee or groin. Use your hands to push your body back to a front stance.

Sikuan.name: Sikuan Dalam
Sikuan.desc: Bend your arm. Swing your elbow inwards while pulling your fist close to your chest, striking inwards with your elbow.

Sikuan.name: Sikuan Luar
Sikuan.desc: Bend your arm. Bring your fist and opposite hand together to your other shoulder, then strke outwards with your elbow

Sikuan.name: Sikuan Atas
Sikuan.desc: Bend your arm. Swing your elbow upwards while keeping your hand close to your head. Keep the hand close to your ear at the time of impact. Your hand palm should be facing towards your ear at time of impact.

Sikap.name: Sikap Satria
Sikap.desc: Posing as if you are a warrior holding a big sheild.

Sikap.name: Sikap Minang
Sikap.desc: This stance invites your opponent to enter, and is a set-up for a side kick.

Sikap.name: Sikap Harimau
Sikap.desc: There are several ways to do the Sikap Harimau. See pictures below.

Sikap.name: Sikap Garuda
Sikap.desc: Eagle Stance strikes the pose of an eagle.

Sikap.name: Sikap Naga
Sikap.desc: Striking the pose of a Dragon

Tangkapan.name: Tangkapan Kaki Luar
Tangkapan.desc: This catch is to catch a front or sidekick. You must be on the outside of your opponents leg/body.

Tangkapan.name: Tangkapan Kaki Dalam
Tangkapan.desc: This catch is usually to catch a Sabit (Roundhouse) kick. One hand must be facing up, the other down. You trap the leg in the inside of the elbow.

Jurus.name: Tunggal
Jurus.desc: This forum is usually performed by a single person. It consists of 100 techniques. Jurus Tunggal begins with an empty-hand form, followed by a form with a golok weapon (machete), then finishing with a form with the (toya) or rattan staff.  It must be completed in 3 minutes, but a tolerance period of +/-10 seconds is allowed for Pre-teen and Pre-Junior categories while +/-5 seconds for the Junior, Senior and Masters categories. Should the performance go beyond the time limit, penalty will be imposed accordingly. Uttering of voice (yelling) is allowed but discouraged.  The form must be completed with precise techniques (with and without weapon), rhythmic movement, firmness and expression.

Jurus.name: Regu
Jurus.desc: Jurus Regu is an empty-hand form usually performed by three people. It has 100 techniques and must be completed in 3 (three) minutes. A tolerance period of +/- 5 seconds is allowed. You cannot set out of the arena even with one foot. The form must be completed with precise techniques, rhythmic movement, firmness and expression.

Other.name: Tusukan
Other.desc: Aim for the vitals such as eyes and throat. Hand can be vertical if striking the groin, or horizontal if striking the neck.

Other.name: Tabrakan
Other.desc: Crashing into your opponent using your shoulder.

Other.name: Tebangan
Other.desc: Using the knife of your hand to chop the neck.

Other.name: Tebasan Luar
Other.desc: Striking outward with the knife of your hand with open palm facing downwards.

Other.name: Roll Forwards
Other.desc: Roll forward with your with your shoulder, without hitting your head to the floor.

Other.name: Roll Backwards
Other.desc: Roll backwards with your with your shoulder, without hitting your head to the floor.

Other.name: Bracing Your Fall
Other.desc: When falling backwards, your hands should be away from your body to help prevent injury.
